## VecPool.mallocArray() method

Intended to provide individual vector views of a larger underlying buffer. Attempts to allocate a single block of sufficient memory to hold `num` vectors of `size` elements and if successful returns array of vectors mapping the buffer with given stride lengths (both component and element strides can be provided).

\*Note:\* Since all result vectors share the same continuous memory block, freeing any of them from the pool will invalidate all of them.

Also see: - `Vec2.mapBuffer()` - `Vec3.mapBuffer()` - `Vec4.mapBuffer()` - `NDArray1.mapBuffer()`

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
mallocArray(num: number, size: number, cstride?: number, estride?: number, type?: GLType | Type): StridedVec[] | undefined;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  num | <code>number</code> |  |
|  size | <code>number</code> |  |
|  cstride | <code>number</code> |  |
|  estride | <code>number</code> |  |
|  type | <code>GLType &#124; Type</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`StridedVec[] | undefined`
